Package org.jlab.coda.hipo

Class RecordInputStream

java.lang.Object
org.jlab.coda.hipo.RecordInputStream
public class RecordInputStream extends Object
Class which reads data to create an Evio or HIPO Record. This class is NOT thread safe! 

 RECORD STRUCTURE:

               Uncompressed                                      Compressed

    +----------------------------------+            +----------------------------------+
    |       General Record Header      |            |       General Record Header      |
    +----------------------------------+            +----------------------------------+

    +----------------------------------+ ---------> +----------------------------------+
    |           Index Array            |            |        Compressed Data           |
    +----------------------------------+            |             Record               |
                                                    |                                  |
    +----------------------------------+            |                                  |
    |           User Header            |            |                  ----------------|
    |           (Optional)             |            |                  |    Pad 3      |
    |                  ----------------|            +----------------------------------+
    |                  |    Pad 1      |           ^
    +----------------------------------+          /
                                                 /
    +----------------------------------+       /
    |           Data Record            |     /
    |                                  |    /
    |                  ----------------|   /
    |                  |    Pad 2      | /
    +----------------------------------+




 GENERAL RECORD HEADER STRUCTURE ( see RecordHeader.java )

    +----------------------------------+
  1 |         Record Length            | // 32bit words, inclusive
    +----------------------------------+
  2 +         Record Number            |
    +----------------------------------+
  3 +         Header Length            | // 14 (words)
    +----------------------------------+
  4 +       Event (Index) Count        |
    +----------------------------------+
  5 +      Index Array Length          | // bytes
    +-----------------------+---------+
  6 +       Bit Info        | Version  | // version (8 bits)
    +-----------------------+----------+
  7 +      User Header Length          | // bytes
    +----------------------------------+
  8 +          Magic Number            | // 0xc0da0100
    +----------------------------------+
  9 +     Uncompressed Data Length     | // bytes
    +------+---------------------------+
 10 +  CT  |  Data Length Compressed   | // CT = compression type (4 bits)
    +----------------------------------+
 11 +        General Register 1        | // UID 1st (64 bits)
    +--                              --+
 12 +                                  |
    +----------------------------------+
 13 +        General Register 2        | // UID 2nd (64 bits)
    +--                              --+
 14 +                                  |
    +----------------------------------+
Since:
6.0 10/13/17
Version:
6.0
Author:
gavalian

  • Method Details

    • getHeader

      public RecordHeader getHeader()
      Get the header of this record.
      Returns:
      header of this record.

    • getByteOrder

      public ByteOrder getByteOrder()
      Get the byte order of the internal buffers.
      Returns:
      byte order of the internal buffers.

    • getUncompressedDataBuffer

      public ByteBuffer getUncompressedDataBuffer()
      Get the buffer with all uncompressed data in it. It's position and limit are set to read only event data. That means no header, index, or user-header.
      Returns:
      the buffer with uncompressed event data in it.

    • hasIndex

      public boolean hasIndex()
      Does this record contain an event index?
      Returns:
      true if record contains an event index, else false.

    • hasUserHeader

      public boolean hasUserHeader()
      Does this record contain a user header?
      Returns:
      true if record contains a user header, else false.

    • getEvent

      public byte[] getEvent(int index)
      Get the event at the given index and return it in an allocated array. Not threadsafe as internal buffer's pos and limit may change momentarily, but are unchanged on return. This method allocates memory and thus creates garbage.
      Parameters:
      index - index of event starting at 0. If index too large, it's set to last index. If negative, it's set to 0.
      Returns:
      byte array containing event.

    • getEvent

      public int getEvent(byte[] event, int off, int index) throws BufferOverflowException
      Get the event at the given index and return it in the given array. Not threadsafe as internal buffer's pos and limit may change momentarily, but are unchanged on return.
      Parameters:
      event - byte array in which to place event.
      off - offset in event to place event. Negative values set to 0.
      index - index of event starting at 0. If index too large, it's set to last index. If negative, it's set to 0.
      Returns:
      number of data bytes written into event array.
      Throws:
      BufferOverflowException - if event array too small.

    • getEventLength

      public int getEventLength(int index)
      Returns the length of the event with given index.
      Parameters:
      index - index of the event
      Returns:
      length of the data in bytes.

    • getEvent

      public ByteBuffer getEvent(ByteBuffer buffer, int index) throws HipoException
      Get the event at the given index and write it into the given byte buffer. The given byte buffer has to be large enough to receive all the event's data, but the buffer.limit() is ignored and reset. If no buffer is given (arg is null), create a buffer internally and return it. Buffer's byte order is set to that of the internal buffers. Buffer pos and lim are ready to read on return. Not threadsafe as internal buffer's pos and limit may change momentarily, but are unchanged on return.
      Parameters:
      buffer - buffer to be filled with event starting at position = 0
      index - index of event starting at 0. Negative value = 0.
      Returns:
      buffer or newly allocated buffer if arg is null.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if buffer has insufficient space to contain event (buffer.capacity() < event size).

    • getEvent

      public ByteBuffer getEvent(ByteBuffer buffer, int bufOffset, int index) throws HipoException
      Get the event at the given index and write it into the given byte buffer. The given byte buffer has to be large enough to receive all the event's data, but the buffer.limit() is ignored and reset. If no buffer is given (arg is null), create a buffer internally and return it. Buffer's byte order is set to that of the internal buffers. Buffer pos and lim are ready to read on return. Not threadsafe as internal buffer's pos and limit may change momentarily, but are unchanged on return.
      Parameters:
      buffer - buffer to be filled with event.
      bufOffset - offset into buffer to place event.
      index - index of event starting at 0. Negative value = 0.
      Returns:
      buffer or newly allocated buffer if arg is null.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if buffer has insufficient space to contain event (buffer.capacity() - bufOffset < event size).

    • getUserHeader

      public byte[] getUserHeader()
      Get the user header contained in this record.
      Returns:
      the user header contained in this record, or null if none.

    • getUserHeader

      public ByteBuffer getUserHeader(ByteBuffer buffer, int bufOffset) throws HipoException
      Get any existing user header and write it into the given byte buffer. The given byte buffer must be large enough to contain user header. If no buffer is given (arg is null), create a buffer internally and return it. Buffer's byte order is set to that of the internal buffers. Buffer's position is set to bufOffset and limit is set to bufOffset + userHeader size.
      Parameters:
      buffer - buffer to be filled with user header. If null, create one and return that.
      bufOffset - offset into buffer to place user header.
      Returns:
      buffer (or newly allocated buffer if arg is null) if header exists and successfully copied into buffer, or null if no user header exists.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if buffer has insufficient space to contain user header (buffer.capacity() - bufOffset < user header size). If buffer is not null and offset negative.

    • getUserHeaderAsRecord

      public RecordInputStream getUserHeaderAsRecord(ByteBuffer buffer, int bufOffset) throws HipoException
      Get any existing user header and write it into the given byte buffer. The byte buffer must be large enough to contain it. Warning, buffer.limit() is ignored and reset. If no buffer is given (arg is null), create a buffer internally and use it. Parse the user header into the returned recordInputStream object.
      Parameters:
      buffer - buffer to be filled with user header
      bufOffset - offset into buffer to place user header.
      Returns:
      record parsed from user header or null if no user header exists.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if non-null buffer has insufficient space to contain user header (buffer.capacity() - bufOffset < user header size). If offset negative.

    • readRecord

      public void readRecord(RandomAccessFile file, long position) throws HipoException
      Reads record from the file at given position. Call this method or readRecord(ByteBuffer, int) before calling any other. Any compressed data is decompressed. Memory is allocated as needed. First the header is read, then the length of the record is read from header, then following bytes are read and decompressed. Handles the case in which index array length = 0.
      Parameters:
      file - opened file descriptor
      position - position in the file
      Throws:
      HipoException - if file not in hipo format or if bad argument(s)

    • readRecord

      public void readRecord(ByteBuffer buffer, int offset) throws HipoException
      Reads a record from the buffer at the given offset. Call this method or readRecord(RandomAccessFile, long) before calling any other. Any compressed data is decompressed. Memory is allocated as needed. Handles the case in which index array length = 0.
      Parameters:
      buffer - buffer containing record data.
      offset - offset into buffer to beginning of record data.
      Throws:
      HipoException - if buffer not in hipo format or if bad argument(s)

    • getEntries

      public int getEntries()
      Returns number of the events packed in the record.
      Returns:
      number of the events packed in the record.

      test main program

      args - args.
